name: Weaving a dark web
description:
In contemporary Hollywood cinema, children's films often align with comedy and musical genres. However, harking back to the days of European fairytales (and certainly beyond), children's stories are historically dark in tone and were written for both children and adult audiences alike. 
With an apocalyptic threat looming large, Moomins and the Comet Chase veers more into darker territory. However, it is the talented voice cast that conjures some connections to some pure cinema darkness.

key_work.title: Moomins and the Comet Chase
key_work.creator_credit: Maria Lindberg, Ilkka Peltola, Tom Carpelan, Filmkompaniet, Jupiter-Film, Se-Ma-For, Anders Larsson, Iivo Baric, Joel Backström and Minna Karvonen
key_work.brief_description: One day Moomintroll wakes to notice that grey dust is covering everything in the Moominvalley. He runs to ask the philosophical Muskrat if he knows what is happening, who advises him that things tend to look like this before an awful fate coming from the sky hits the Earth. With the help of his father, Moominpappa, Moomintroll and his close friends Sniff and Snufkin build a raft and head out on a challenging journey to the observatory in the Lonely Mountains hoping to find out more from the wise professors there. The friends have to overcome several adversities in order to make it there. When they arrive, they find the professors deep in calculations. They reveal that a comet will reach the Earth in four days, four hours, four minutes and 44 seconds.

start.title: The Northman
start.creator_credit: Robert Eggers, Linda Muir, Louise Ford, Alexander Skarsgård, Arnon Milchan, Lars Knudsen, Leifur B. Dagfinnsson, Mark Huffam, New Regency Pictures, Regency Enterprises, Square Peg, Craig Lathrop and Sjón
start.brief_description: Prince Amleth is on the verge of becoming a man when his father is brutally murdered by his uncle, who kidnaps the boy’s mother. Two decades later, Amleth is now a Viking who’s on a mission to save his mother, kill his uncle and avenge his father.

constellations_other.name: Papa-paparazzi
constellations_other.description: Media attention and paparazzi from the assassination of JFK to Lady Gaga's music video.

links.description: In 2009, Alexander Skarsgård appeared as a murderous boyfriend alongside Lady Gaga in the Paparazzi music video directed by Jonas Åkerlund.

end.title: Hannibal
end.creator_credit: Christopher Hargadon, AXN Original Production, Gaumont International Television, Living Dead Guy Productions and The De Laurentiis Company
end.brief_description: Both a gift and a curse, Graham has the extraordinary ability to think like his prey—he sees what they see, feels what they feel. But while Graham is pursuing an especially troubling, cannibalistic murderer, Special Agent Jack Crawford teams him with a highly respected psychiatrist – a man with a taste for the criminal minded – Dr. Hannibal Lecter.

links.description: Three years after voicing Sniff in Moomins and the Comet Chase, Mads Mikkelsen took on the role of Hannibal Lecter in the series Hannibal.

start.title: Dominion: Prequel to The Exorcist
start.creator_credit: Paul Schrader, Luke Reichle, Tim Silano, William Yeh, James G. Robinson, Morgan Creek Entertainment, John Graysmark, Corrado Rizzo, Lucio Farina, Massimo Cipollina, Nicola Sganga, Salvo Severino, Caleb Carr and William Wisher
start.brief_description: Father Merrin takes a sabbatical from the Church to devote himself to history and archaeology as he struggles with his shattered faith.

links.description: Before and after playing Moomintroll in Moomins and the Comet Chase, Alexander Skarsgård appeared in many dark roles. In 2022, he appeared in Robert Eggers’ Hamlet-inspired The Northman.

With an apocalyptic threat looming large, Moomins and the Comet Chase veers more into darker territory. However, it is the talented voice cast that conjures some connections to some pure cinema darkness.

links.description: Stellan Skarsgård who voices Moominpapa in Moomins and the Comet Chase previously appeared as Father Merrin in Dominion: Prequel to The Exorcist (2005). Coincidentally, his Moomins co-star Max von Sydow played the character in the original 1972 film The Exorcist.
